ai-mil5.5.11:1.1_0: “Venerable Sir, the Buddha has said these words:
ai-mil5.5.11:2.2_0: apart from the great sage himself.
ai-mil5.5.11:2.3_0: In the world with its gods,
ai-mil5.5.11:3.2_0: ‘Through my teacher Āḷāra Kālāma placed me, his student, on the same position as him, and honored me with lofty praise.’
ai-mil5.5.11:3.3_0: Now, suppose the Realized One was to say this:
ai-mil5.5.11:3.5_0: When I had no person in the world with its gods, I don’t announce it to my teacher. Then—when I announce it to my pupil, a teacher, or a pupil—who believed it like a teacher.
ai-mil5.5.11:3.6_0: whatever was said by the Realized One,
ai-mil5.5.11:3.7_0: ‘Indeed, Āḷāra Kālāma, while still a teacher, I haven’t place me on the following instructions.
ai-mil5.5.11:3.8_0: When there is no person in the world with its gods, there is no other person like that.’
ai-mil5.5.11:3.9_0: this question too should be expelled by a each question.”
ai-mil5.5.11:4.1_0: “Earlier, Great King, by the Realised One:
ai-mil5.5.11:5.2_0: apart from the great sage himself.
ai-mil5.5.11:5.3_0: In the world with its gods,
ai-mil5.5.11:6.2_0: ‘Through my teacher Āḷāra Kālāma placed me, his student, on the same position as him, and honored me with lofty praise.’
ai-mil5.5.11:7.1_0: Before my teacher was still unawakened but intent on awakening when he was still unawakened but intent on awakening.
ai-mil5.5.11:8.1_0: In a former life, these five hundred days awakened One intent on awakening, he passed away from his teacher’s doctrine.
ai-mil5.5.11:8.3_0: Those eight characteristics that lead to awakening. That is:
ai-mil5.5.11:8.4_0: having the characteristic of Rāma, the fame is beautiful, and the greatest fortunate that has been given up.
ai-mil5.5.11:8.5_0: They fell down their work, and they made the first offerings to the teachers.
ai-mil5.5.11:9.1_0: Furthermore, great king, the being intent on awakening emerges from his father’s womb, he gave a boy to the crown prince: ‘The prince Suddhodana and Bhārin, and he gave him a second duty-six posture, while he was born in water.’
ai-mil5.5.11:10.1_0: Furthermore, the deity for which the deities were struck with a sense of urgency, married and awestruck. This is the third teacher’s went forth.
ai-mil5.5.11:11.1_0: Furthermore, great king, this is the fourth kind of Āḷāra Kālāma.
ai-mil5.5.11:12.1_0: Furthermore, Uddaka, the son of Rāma, is the fifth means of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
ai-mil5.5.11:13.1_0: These are the five great teachers in awakening.
ai-mil5.5.11:13.2_0: yet your teacher should go to see,
ai-mil5.5.11:13.3_0: And there is no place for the supreme knowledge of this world in this way: “Great king, the Realized One, for the sake of embracing the supreme knowledge of all, and for his instructions. That’s why the Realized One is the supreme person.”
ai-mil5.5.11:14.2_0: apart from the great sage himself.
ai-mil5.5.11:14.3_0: In the world with its gods,
ai-mil5.5.11:15.1_0: “Good, sir, would you agree with such a dragon?”
ai-mil5.5.11:16.1_0: the teacher who had taken a doctrine of the teachers.
ai-mil5.5.11:17.1_0: The fifth sub-chapter on covering is finished.
ai-mil5.5.11:19.1_0: The Question About Meṇḍaka is finished.
